Where can you stay and actually get to talk to the owners on a daily basis? We stayed here for 6 nights to visit the San Diego Zoo, Legoland, Disneyland, local beaches, and local attractions. We actually didn't know who ran the chain until the 2nd morning of our stay because all the staff members are so helpful and friendly. They are always asking if everything was ok and if we needed to find somewhere to go for shopping, dining, or attractions to visit. Summary of how friendly the staff and owners were: 1) We left our shampoo at home and they allowed us to have some for free without charging us. 2) We also left our hair dryer at home and they supplied one for us. 3) No matter where we wanted to go, the staff and owners were always able to answer our questions or take the time to show us on a map or draw on a map. 4) The father and son (owners) always made us feel at home like it was a bed and breakfast at the beach!!! They were particular in entertaining our 4 year old son. 5) Breakfast is FREE - Daily bananas, muffins, and yogurt with coffee or orange juice. 6) Last and best, our flight back to North Carolina was not scheduled to depart until 10:50 PST, which is 1:50 AM EST. So we asked the owner (father) if we could check out later than 12 pm since our son naps still. They allowed us to check out at 3 pm vs. 12 pm so our son could get a nap FREE OF CHARGE!!!!!!. The only reason why I gave 1 less than the 5 stars for service was the house cleaning does just a little later than normal. And the only reason for the 1 less than the full 5 stars for sleep quality, was due to the one of the beds being harder than our home bed. But again, this is personal preference. We were not surprised by the room size as the pictures clearly show the size but it was just enough for the three of us. The rooms are always clean and kept up very well. All in all, we would stay here every time if we come back to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Awesomw”
Reviews.Author: lvwoman56
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at you motel twice. I love love love it and so does my husband.We live in Vegas and we have stayed at the Palazzo,Aria Encoreand others. I have never seen a Motel or Hotel as clean as yours. I really appreciate the friendliness and helpfulness of your staff.I can't wait to come back this year. I dont even mind sitting in the courtyard to smoke,I actually enjoy talking to the owners there.You just don't find that anywhere,I certainly never see Steve Wynn at the Encore .My friend who is a bit of a Hotel snob likes to refer to the Dolphin as my boutique hotel Hey works for me.My husband has told his friends and they love it too. Thank you for making our stay wonderful Will probably be back in July or Aug.Can't Wait

Reviews.Title: “A trip back in time”
Reviews.Author: Amador
Reviews.Content: The place was spotlessly clean and well maintained, and the owners/staff were friendly and helpful. However, our room above the office was tiny, and straight out of 1940. Not a thing had been updated except for the TV. We left after one night, in search of a roomier and more up-to-date room.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service does exsists!”
Reviews.Author: dmtravler
Reviews.Content: Dolphin Motel is so awesome. I have to tell you that I almost stayed next door. -m so glad we came here instead. I was blown away with the staff and the owners of this Motel. They made me and my fiance feel as if we were the only ones there! The rooms are nice and very clean too. In the morning they offer muffins, coffee, orange juice, tea, yogart, banannas. I loved the bannanas and yogart with my muffins each morning. There was also a newspapeer available too. We really enjoyed our stay and felt genuinally welcomed. Can't wait to return this summer. -Doreen Mobley

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at The Dolphin Motel”
Reviews.Author: SteveKinSF
Reviews.Content: When I travel I try to stay at clean, family run hotels and this place fits the bill. It's nice to talk to the owners Alan & Holly over their continental breakfast every morning. Rooms were very clean as usual and the staff helpful and friendly. Love this place! Makes me feel at home...I'll be back. P.S. Don't much care for the big impersonal chains.

Reviews.Title: “We've been coming to the Dolphin Motel...”
Reviews.Author: CDinsmore
Reviews.Content: We've been coming to the Dolphin Motel for nearly 7 years now and I couldn't ask for a better place to stay while on vacation in San Diego. Mr. Murdock and his son Alan are the most gracious hosts I've ever had the pleasure of knowing. The location of the hotel is perfect for anywhere you want to go in San Diego. The rooms are clean, warm, and inviting and the friendly atmosphere in the morning with excellent coffee, tea, and muffins will make you want to stay all day and enjoy the gorgeous view. You will never want to stay anywhere else once you've stayed here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Relax!”
Reviews.Author: dobieluvrs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our anniversary and plan to do that each year. The motel is always clean and well maintained. It is small but really if you are in San Diego how much time is spent in the room anyway? The beds are always clean and well kept... and after speaking to the owner and his son during our stay we think this is by far the best place in San Diego hands down. There is a small breakfast offering (muffins and coffee) which we love to partake of as we stroll across the street to the harbor and watch the fishing boats loading up for their day at sea. Truly this place is AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly, very clean, great location!”
Reviews.Author: sarahpalin2012
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dolphin Motel for our first vacation ever with our 2 little ones (ages 2 & 5) and had a great time! I am a clean freak and the rooms were spotless! White everything, so you would be able to see if it were dirty, but it wasnt! The rooms were small, but it worked out great, the kids just did everything on their bed, played with toys, colored, read, watched cartoons. The bathroom was cute, I loved the old tile, it had charm:) The kids to this day ( 6 months later!) still talk about the nice man that brought them McDonalds apple pies EVERY single morning we were there! That nice older man was the OWNER! He was so sweet and just loved to see the kids in the morning! We live in the desert , so to sit outside with an ocean breeze, listening to seagulls while sipping coffee every morning was heaven! The houskeeping girl was so nice as well! We always go through a lot of towels and she was always right there to hand us more! And let me tell you how much nicer our vacation was because of the nice front desk man! He recommended so many fun things to do, and we did all of them! Our favorite was Coronado Beach and Sea World! And dont forget the great restaurant Pizza Nova right across the street! And walking by the water watching the fishing boats come in was fun for us AND the kids! Oh, it was such a beautiful, safe and clean part of town! To the father and son owners and the small personable staff, thank you for a GREAT first family vacation last year! Cant wait to come back and enjoy your beautiful city once again! THANK YOU SO MUCH! Bryan & Kim Greene Boulder City, Nevada

Reviews.Title: “A nice visit.”
Reviews.Author: rheo3000
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, white and looks exactly like picture. The room was small, as expected. My only complaint was how thin the walls are. My husband and I went to dinner and a movie. We got back to the room a little after 11 on Saturday. We turned on the tv and within 5 minutes the neighbor knocked on the door and told us that we would need be quiet. It was a little shocking as we were not making noise beyond the tv and a few comments between us about what time we'd be leaving in the morning. I would not recommend staying in the motel if you are planning to do anything at night. Overall a good stay. Close to everything to do in San Diego. A clean and safe base from which to explore San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap rooms - clean but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: mysei
Reviews.Content: Stayed because of the price. The rooms are very small, with very few amenities. No phone, no clock radio or alarm, table but did have a folding chair and Internet. It did have wide screen TV and refrigerator which was odd because a clock radio only costs about $10. Management as most people noted is very friendly and accommodating. Breakfast is muffins, juice, coffee and yogurt. Close to airport, Shelter Island, and Cabrillo(?) Park. There really is no view. Mattress was very hard. I did feel safe. Look at the pictures as they are not hiding anything. Bottom line -- it is cheap and it is clean. Don't expect too much more.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: TravelerFL
Reviews.Content: .....this was my fourth stay over the years....and this stay was once again, an excellent experience.....with the owners on site, its a great place to stay...let me list a few things. .....room and bath....SPOTLESS .....matress more comfortable than that I have in my home .....white everything....sheets, bed spread....and wonderful fluffy huge bath towels .....continental b'fast w/muffins, juice, yogurt, and GOOD coffee (a rare find on freebie hotel b'fasts) .....and before I forget.......THE PRICE WAS RIGHT!....particularly in 'pricey' San Diego! .....oh yes, the free HS internet was a welcome plus There is a good variety of restaurants nearby (and a new one a block away set to open this Spring) .....so I asked myself....."What's not to like?".....and my answer was...."The time came that I had to leave!" .....guess what?.....I'm already looking forward to my next visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, excellent, excellent!”
Reviews.Author: pedalcrazy
Reviews.Content: This is the type of accommodation budget conscious travellers look for but rarely find, a combination of great location, sparkling clean rooms, reasonable rates and hosts that cannot do enough for their guests. Located across the street from Fisherman's Landing on the north side of San Diego Bay this 31 unit, two storey motel, is close to the airport, I-5 freeway, numerous attractions including Sea World, excellent Mexican restaurants and a take-out sea food eatery that is a favorite with locals and visitors alike. Upper level rooms have a view of the harbour. Rooms on the first floor open onto a spacious walled courtyard where guests enjoy free coffee and muffins in the morning. The facility offers free Wi-fi and a loaner lap-top computer for those guests who did not bring their own. My interest was in bicycling. The motel owners graciously provided convenient storage for my bike as well as suggestions and directions for bicycle tours. The area has numerous bike paths; trips of 10 to 20 miles can be safely and conveniently done starting from this location. I enjoyed the hospitality at the Dolphin Motel for a week in December 2009 and hope to visit there again in 2010. I recommend this gem of a motel for travellers interested in clean, safe, basic, and very hospitable accommodation in a convenient area of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Family owned and run, friendly service, small clean rooms in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: hahnecho
Reviews.Content: This is an old, family owned/run, motel that is very conveniently located and inexpensive. The owners, Murdocks, are actually there most of the time and offer friendly service. The rooms are small but clean with good wi-fi connections. Heater/ac units are a bit primitive but they work and, besides, who cares; this is San Diego. The office is very helpful in weighing your bags, printing out boarding passes, etc. A byproduct of such a place is that the guests are very friendly, too; the friendly atmosphere must rub off on all of us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: bigtonymartinez
Reviews.Content: My son and I were referred to this motel by our taxi driver when we arrived to the area close to the airport he explained how this motel usually is cheaper than the surrounding ones. Upon check in we were quoted a fair rate of 60 dollars plus tax for a single bed room for the 2 of us, and the night clerk realizing that we would be taking off for a flight earlier the next morning upgraded our room to one with 2 beds. When we got to room #28 I was glad to see how clean it was. The sheets were bright white and the carpet was spotless. All in all the whole room looked clean because it WAS clean. We slept comfortably and got up around 8 am, there was coffee and muffins set out in the courtyard for the people staying at the motel, there was WIFI available and it required a password. Although our stay was short we were glad to have stayed, the taxi fare to the airport was about 8 dollars. This is definately a good place to rest up and also to spend some leisure time, we were close to the marina and could see the boats. Wish we had more time we wanted to see what restaurants were nearby for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Still the Best!!”
Reviews.Author: erniehammers
Reviews.Content: It was our second time staying at the Dolphin Motel in San Diego (Point Loma) and once again we were thoroughly impressed!! The rooms are spotless and the location is great!! It is just a 5 to 10 minute cab from SAN airport. I had our same room overlooking the pool which was very clean and quiet!! The owners father and son- Holly & Allen Murdock are the most gracious hosts!! They provide fresh muffins and hot coffee/juice in the courtyard each morning, where you can sit and read the paper under the sun umbrellas. They also are very helpful in helping you plan day trips in the San Diego area. Prices are great and the location is tops!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Motel For Fishermen”
Reviews.Author: PlanetYellowfin
Reviews.Content: Up until last year I lived in Chicago, and I came to San Diego for long-range fishing once per year. I stayed at the Dolphin because it was the cheapest motel near the landing, and because it was the closest motel to the landing. Both of these facts remain true... I moved to San Diego a year ago because I am an avid long-range fisherman. Every time I embark on a fishing trip, the day before the trip I stay at the Dolphin. First, I don't want a driving nightmare in the morning as I try to make it to the dock in time to plant my tackle box near the front of the line (get the best location for tackle on the boat). Second, I can leisurely stroll to and from the dock as boats come in, and check out the catch, say hello to other fishermen leaving on my trip (or similar trips) the next day, check out the local tackle shops--there are about a dozen of them, and they are some of the best-equipped in the world. The famous bar, Captain's Quarters--where all the fishermen and crew hang out, both before and after a trip--is about 150 feet away. Shelter Island is where the headliner musical groups show, and it is a fun moderate walk from the Dolphin, as is the second-best view of the downtown--out on Shelter Island. Downtown, Cabrillo (the BEST view of San Diego), America's Cup Harbor, Balboa Park (maybe a dozen attractions there), old town, Mission Bay, Ocean Beach (remember the volleyball scene in Top Gun)--location, location, location... My favorite reason to stay at the Dolphin is that it is, literally, the closest motel to the docks. They have available a convenient hand cart than I use to move heavy stuff effortlessly across Scott street. The parking is a blessing: lit, wide, 24/7 real-time video surveillance, on-site. No worries about leaving $25000 worth of gear in the car. The house staff have been on payroll for decades (no tipping, no worries)--it is family run, Holly and Allyn are well-known, well-respected and like old-school true locals. The staff, Steve, John, Steven are the seasoned vets, are professional real people. The rooms are comfortable and clean. There is no wasted space, but plenty of room for plenty of gear. I once stayed in a 2-bed unit, with 700 pounds of fishing gear, and two computers set-up as a network, for two weeks as my apartment was being readied for my move-in. There is free coffee and the best muffin I've found in Point Loma every morning--perfect for the trips back and forth to use the bathroom while waiting for the boat to load (we usually go to the dock at 4 AM for a noon departure, to get a good place in line). The place is perfect for a fisherman. Once starts living the dream when the check into the Dolphin, believe me...

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful, good value”
Reviews.Author: riverandsnow
Reviews.Content: I echo the previous reviews. Yes, the rooms are small and it has minimal amenities, but it is VERY clean, is available for a good price and has an excellentand central location. Perfect for staging a long range fishing trip or playing touriston a budget. Everyone there was extremely helpful. I had family issues which required that I extend my stay. They really made things easier. You could easily come to think of them as extended family.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money with a million dollar view!!”
Reviews.Author: MontyVictoria
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room upstairs with the use of the balcony to relax and enjoy the view towards the Sports Fishing Marina just a short distance away. The rooms are small clean and adequate, with a small alcove/wardrobe in our room for the the storage of extra luggage. We were at the end of a 6 week trip through the USA so were preparing for a long journey home; last minute shopping and a day at Seaworld were on the agenda. It was a pleasure to meet management who were interested in their guests and who were prepared to assist in anyway possible to make our stay comfortable and ensure that our onward journey was trouble free. Included in the price are free wifi, breakfast, secure parking, refrigerator in each room. Rooms are non smoking.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel,friendly service,but small quarters”
Reviews.Author: daisy0914
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just like described clean,but cozy quarters. The service of staff was friendly,helpful, very knowledgeable of area. The rooms are clean,small,and yes,air conditioner is close to bed. Excellent location,close to marina,downtown and airport. We only stayed one evening,due to flying out the next day. If you arent going to spending a ot of time in room,this hotel fits the bill. It is reasonable priced,,clean,and couldnt get any closer to marina(nice view from hotel). Just to spend a few nights,couldnt imagine being this close of quarters for any longer.tho.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly - GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: DumboStuttgart
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dolphin Motel for 2 nights during our honeymoon and we loved it. The room was small but clean. Who stays in the room the whole day? The banana-nut muffins in the morning were lovely and the coffee was tasty too. Staff was helpful and the owner like your best friend! We would definitely stay there again. Main street really close and harbor too but no problems with noises at night. Only thing missing was a hairdryer but that's it. We recommend a room with harborview.

Reviews.Title: “great deal, clean, location...”
Reviews.Author: jjim
Reviews.Content: Nice clean basic hotel. Breakfast on the run. Helpful friendly staff. Positioned in the middle of everything...Price is right on.....Quiet... Interesting neighborhood near the fishing marina and restaurants....

Reviews.Title: “An "okay" 1-night stopover”
Reviews.Author: gravimetrix
Reviews.Content: Stopped at The Dolphin for 1 night - prebooked it ahead of our visit direct after reading reviews on Tripadvisor. The motel itself is well positioned, on the front and in a residential district. It's a no-frills establishment and our room (#32) was very basic. For a 1-night stay it's ok but we couldn't have stopped another night here if we had to. The staff were very helpful and friendly though and pointed us in the right direction for a good mexican meal in the evening! Breakfast was very basic - coffee and muffins. In summary - ok for 1 night but I probably wouldn't stay again if visiting San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky charm. Good location. VERY nice people.”
Reviews.Author: aw_port
Reviews.Content: The staff is so helpful. Room is not fancy at all, bed wasn't comfortable, room was small... but it has everything you need: shower, bed, refrigerator, AC, etc. Besides, WHO CARES what the room is like when youre in San Diego. There's so much to do, and the Point Loma area around the hotel was safe and totally walkable. And the place has a quirky old-school charm that you just dont find very often. For the price, I'll definitely be going back on my trips to San Diego, and say hi to Alan and the staff again. Next time I'll try and book a half-day fishing trip for some mahi-mahi or something, since the marina is right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FAMILY OWNED BUSINESS”
Reviews.Author: consumer2SanDiego
Reviews.Content: Thanks to an exceptional staff. My daughter and I had to meet in San Diego for appointments and needed affordable motel for five nights. This family owned motel exceeded my expectations. Everyone is friendly and helpful. Room was very clean. Coffee and pastry provided on the patio was exacltly what we needed to get our day started. When in San Diego again this hotel will be my first choice. We felt safe and protected. Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff at a good quality motel”
Reviews.Author: frangipani89
Reviews.Content: This motel is great if all that you really need is somewhere to stay at night before heading out to the sights in San Diego. Rooms are tad on the small side but very very clean. Muffins, tea, coffee and OJ are outside for a quick breakfast in the morning. Free wireless internet is a plus There's a view of Fisherman's Landing, and we were able to see the July 4th fireworks from our balcony too! Staff at the motel are really helpful, and we were able to use one of their lockers for our things on the day we checked out as we were going to Seaworld and didnt want to bring everything in the car. Rates were great too- about $100/night and it had everything that we needed (clean room and comfy bed) and was also very close to the Zoo and Seaworld. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service !”
Reviews.Author: kapooh
Reviews.Content: After researching on several places, we have decided to stay at dolphin motel because we read about its excellent service and it's very near the places of interest that we wanted to visit. True enough, the staff were reallyyy friendly and helped us with our heavy luggage. They kept telling us that we could switch to a room with a better view on the next day if we wish to, but we declined it because we have to take the stairs and it would be a hassle to do so with all our heavy luggage. And they said it's fine and that they would help us with it. (: We were lucky to arrive on 4th July, so we asked the owner where is the best place to view the fireworks. He told us where it was and drew a map to show us the exact location. Indeed it turned out to be a really great view and we watched 3 to 4 simultaneous fireworks! On top of that, we spoke to 2 ladies and they said they drove all the way there just to watch the fireworks. For us, we just have to walk a distance from where Dolphin Motel is. The next day, the owner recommended where to have breakfast and even drove us there because we weren't sure of how to make our way there. The breakfast was indeed a gd one. He also drove us to the National Cabrillo Monument and that saved us alot of trouble and time on navigating our way around. The view is so AWESOME anyone who goes to San Diego has to go there! The staff were extremely helpful and provided us with alot of tips on how to get around and which places we can go to with the limited time left in our stay. On our final day before checking out, the owner once again drove us to Shelter Island because we were pressed for time but wanted to visit a place before leaving beautiful San Diego. The owner and staff of Dolphin Motel have indeed gone the extra mile to make our stay an extremely pleasant, comfortable and fuss-free one. A place as beautiful as San Diego deserves a second trip there. I will not hesitate to stay in Dolphin Motel again and will recommend this place to anyone who wants an affordable, comfortable place to stay with excellent staff to boot!

Reviews.Title: “It was OK...”
Reviews.Author: LIJPhilly
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this motel during a recent visit to San Diego because of the reviews on this site. While I wouldn't rate my stay as highly as most for this motel, I would recommend it as a clean, inexpensive, centrally located place to stay in San Diego. As others have said, the rooms are small, but tidy and everything was in working order. Also as stated, the owners were nice and very helpful with suggestions of activities (one even provided me a coupon for the San Diego zoo). A couple of pesky inconveniences---as our room was situated in the corner, there were no chairs placed outside of our rooms if we wanted to sit outside to enjoy the marina. We would have had to sit in front of other guests' rooms. This seemed to just be true of the corner rooms. Also, as the rooms were small, the air conditioner was directly at the head of the bed. Rooms could get stuffy at night (I happen to prefer air conditioning to the windows open at night). Overall, a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay after our cruise!”
Reviews.Author: Bobrowan
Reviews.Content: The Dolphin is very clean & friendly...Family owned! The rooms are small but adequate. At first my wife was a bit hesitant, however after the first nite she exclaimed we gatta stay at more of these family owned hotels. Staff superb. Free coffee, OJ, pastries in the a.m. Overlooking the Marina with nice restaurants & Deep sea fishing charters. Public trasnportation was only one block to take us to Sea World. Little things like calling a cab to take us to the airport was a nice touch. Tip: The upstairs rooms have a nice view of the Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base to see the best of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Pullanissimo
Reviews.Content: The Dolphin has very clean, well appointed rooms, and a nice sized bathroom. Great location near to the marina with a choice of restaurants, and the bus into the centre stops about 10 yards away. Staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, which always makes a great difference to any stay. Good continental breakfast. Free use of a laptop with WiFi connection was also an added unexpected bonus. Doubt you'll find better value for money in the area. One word of warning - if you're not coming by car, its better to get public transport to the motel, which is regular and good if you're arriving from the centre - we got thoroughly ripped off by a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room... great service”
Reviews.Author: scottnjules
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel near the marina - lovely clean clean rooms, small but enough room for 2 people. Great owner and front desk people who are very helpful and friendly. Would recommend for a stay near San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: USA_Traveller09
Reviews.Content: I was only planning to stay one night and ended up staying for 3. Holly the owner, went out of his way to make us comfortable, he even gave us excellent trip ideas. The location is perfect, the free wi fi and complementary breakfast were bonuses and the rooms were extremely clean. I would definitely recommend this motel to anyone looking for good value accommodation. Pound for pound the budget hotel I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms, excellent location, great price.”
Reviews.Author: Tovin
Reviews.Content: Two blocks away from Shelter Island, across the street from the Sportfishing Landing, and in the heart of Point Loma, this motel features a full size mini-fridge and wi-fi (we didn't use). My husband took advantage of the breakfast of donuts, individually wrapped pastries, orange juice and coffee but I don't eat sugar so it was useless to me. Besides, with Perry's only a few minutes away, who'd fill up on that stuff?! The bed was comfy, it was nice having the windows open and smelling the ocean air! But the rooms are small with a bed and folding chair in ours. The bathrooms were teeny and if you don't like sun shining into your room at 6:45am bring eye cover! I think there might have been a second building and I'm certain had I been placed there I would have been let down and not prepared at all for it. Overall it's a great price for a great location. I'd stay here again if I had something to do in the area, but otherwise, I think I'll continue looking for a San Diego gem.

Reviews.Title: “best value”
Reviews.Author: travelingmummy
Reviews.Content: Dolphin Motel has a location and amenities that were really useful to us as we were flying from San Diego after a road trip around California. It's near the airport and near Avis where we planned to drop off our rental car. The wifi worked well and we could check in online and print our boarding passes for free at their office. The rooms are small but they are very clean and neat and they have a large and new flat screen TV in the room. They didn't have a crib for our 10 month old but we just made do by pushing the queen bed against the wall for the night while my hubby slept on the single bed. It's a quiet location and we got a good night's rest. The friendly owner gave us some suggestions on where to go just before returning our car.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that's a deal and has character flush in the middle of a sea of overpriced boring chain hotels”
Reviews.Author: OnlyHighways
Reviews.Content: It's old and unimpressive from the outside, but they pay attention to what really matters. It's a great deal for a great location ($70/night - in Point Loma right on the bay near the San Diego airport - 9 min drive from downtown). The front desk was warm and professional and efficient. The room was basic with the exception of a large flat screen TV, a refrigerator, and free wireless internet - plus it was extremely clean. They provided coffee, orange juice and pastries every morning on the pleasant little patio with tables in the nook of the hotel. There were signs posted in various places., exhorting good behavior from the guests (quiet after 9pm, no fish in the rooms, etc.) - and that's exactly what the place felt like, like you were staying in a simple home but with an attentive and caring mother.

Reviews.Title: “NO wi fi NO window”
Reviews.Author: upt111
Reviews.Content: "Im going to get to the point. BAD:I had room 6. A corner room with no window's ask for another room but there was no more rooms available not blaming them for that.The free wi fi works like CRAP very low signal which means the laptop was moving very slow!!! For $66.30 a day not worth it. GOOD:The staff was nice.Close to the airport.I will never stat there again."

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Spotless”
Reviews.Author: ValerieTa
Reviews.Content: This sweet place was recommended to me by a local taxi driver. It turned out to be right across the street from the sport fishing terminal, and a nice walk to shelter island. The owners offered information about local sites, sketched out maps, and helped in little ways that made our stay more fun. The room was small, but had original fixtures, a pleasant change from the generic chain-motel feel. It had that extra clean feel of linens that have been hung in the sun.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: montanaBillingsMt
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the dolphin for five days. It was ten minutes from sunset cliff beach. it was very close to everything we wanted to see. The owner even drove us down to get a rental car. The night clerk suggested pizza nova the lamb shanks were to die for. Point Loma seafood was very good and just across the street. It is a very quiet location. We took the ferry to corondo island and ate at tartine the mussels were fantastic also homemade passion fruit sorbet,so good we went back for breakfast.on Shelter island drive is a deli at the marina great cheap breakfast and lunch. Many surfers at sunset cliffs also can jump off cliffs. great people clean small room maybe not great for big family. We were very happy with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean Rooms, and very reasonable price!!”
Reviews.Author: ErichMichigan
Reviews.Content: I used to live in San Diego and wanted to show my wife around. The Murdocks were great hosts. The rooms are spotless clean . We stayed on the top floor and loved the view of the harbor. Everything is right at your finger tips. Alan Murdock gave us some good restaurants to eat at and reminded me of some great spots for my wife to see. At the end of our trip the bill for staying at such a nice place put a smile on my face. All thumbs up for this make you feel at home motel !!

Reviews.Title: “Super Value, Very Clean, Helpful Staff, Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Powdergirl53
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 1 night before and after a cruise. This is a small and older style motel but very clean and comfortable, a very good value. Staff and owners couldn't have been more helpful, they even printed our airline boarding passes for us. We were able to check in before noon both times. Walking distance to many nice restaurants. Short distance to airport and cruise terminal. Seems to be in a nice area of town, we walked most everywhere we went and never felt unsafe. If you don't want to pay high prices to stay in large hotels with amenities you'll never use I would recommend the Dolphin Motel.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: hfriel
Reviews.Content: January 2009 spent 4 nights in my favorite city, San Diego. Stayed all four nights in my favorite spot, the Dolphin Motel.Three years ago, stayed there for the first time and have stayed there every year since,The Dolphin Motel is situated in Point Loma, a beautiful area and convenient to all points of Interest in San Diego.The motel is exceptional value for the money.The rooms impeccable and grounds are extremely well kept However what sets this motel apart from the countless others I have stayed in over the years is the owner Holley, his family and the staff.One is greeted and treated like family.They are collectively ,a class act. A point of interest. on the advice of Holley, three years ago, he suggested I pay a visit to Cabrillo National Monument Park.Absolutely spectacular view of San Diego.Once again to Holley and all at the Dolphin thanks again for treating my family like your family and we hope to see you again next year.

Reviews.Title: “4 nights at the Dolphin”
Reviews.Author: BHP1
Reviews.Content: We have visited SD twice before, staying at the Homewood Suites in Del Mar and Motel 6 respectively. This time we wanted to try a location in Point Loma for a number of good reasons. After considering several options (most of the Pt. Loma properties are clustered close together) we opted to try the Dolphin based mainly on price and TripAdvisor reviews. We drove in after dark on I-8 and turned onto Nimitz Ave. at the end of the freeway which brought us right to the Dolphin. Our reservation was accepted and we checked in without problem. Our room was on the second floor which was fine. On first impression we were a bit surprised at the compactness of the room which reminded me of some I had stayed in throughout the UK. Apart from that the room was clean to an acceptable standard and everything that was in it worked accordingly. The place has a kind of '70's feel to it which we have experienced at other SoCal accomodations! We found that the Dolphin was a combination of several pluses and a couple of minuses. The pluses included being situated in Pt. Loma which is a self contained community with most amenities within easy walking distance of the Dolphin. There is a great selection of restaurants, C stores, laundromat, gas stations etc. nearby and the streets are safe to walk after dark. In many ways it resembles most large towns that you would find on the Great Plains with that same "Howdy neighbour" friendliness. Pt. Loma is also strategically located in SD to provide quick access to all of the local attractions. We found that having wi-fi was a great convenience as we packed the laptop along. Morning coffee,OJ, and muffins are served in the outdoor courtyard which is very nice on warm sunny mornings. As many other commenters have mentioned the staff and management are very nice folks. The minuses were few and rather petty. The hotel doesn't have a pool (one is located beside the office but belongs to the neighbouring Comfort Inn.) The hotel advertises itself as being on a quiet street (Garrison) which is technically correct, however it is sandwiched between two very busy streets (Rosecrans and Scott). My wife likes to sleep with the windows open and the early morning traffic was very noticeable. The street traffic can be overcome by closing the windows and turning on the circulating fan. Another irritant was the vibrating roar of fighter jets taking off from North Island late in the evening. The snug rooms are fine for sleeping but don't expect to entertain guests. Overall we were quite satisfied with our stay at the Dolphin and would recommend it to anyone planning a trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Boomvang
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Dolphin on the night before chartering a bareboat out of Harbor Island, and this was a convenient and affordable place to stage our adventure. The reviews that talk about the friendliness factor are 100% accurate--I've never felt more welcome. The rooms are small and very clean...the quaintness reminded me of seaside places I've stayed in New England, and it was a nice change from cookie-cutter national chains. Without even being asked, the staff put a futon in our room to accommodate the fact that we had a queen and a single bed for four people. It's also convenient to a bunch of restaurants (the owner recommended Point Loma Seafoods, right across the street, and it was terrific) and shopping, including West Marine and other gear shops. We'll absolutely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at the Dolphin Motel”
Reviews.Author: PineTree123
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Dolphin Motel. Rooms were small but very clean. Front desk staff was always friendly, helpful and accommodating. The location was safe and we had a nice view of the bay from our second floor room. The breakfast served in the morning on the patio was enjoyable in the beautiful San Diego weather! As a person that generally only makes hotel reservations online I was a bit nervous to trust my reservation made over the phone...if you feel this as well - don't fret - my reservation was safe and the prices we agreed upon on the phone when we made the reservation were exactly what we paid. **Sigh of relief Another side note: We were in town for a wedding. Most people in town were staying at the Ramada right across the street at the suggestion of the couple. Everyone we knew that were staying over there had major issues and were all jealous that we were having a nice time at the Dolphin!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding guest service”
Reviews.Author: faxe
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the dolphin motel without our luggage (it got lost on the flight) we experienced outstanding helpfulness. The owners an the staff were really anxious to supply us with everything we needed to get over the time until we got our bags, which took almost 3 days! Above all the motel is situated perfectly next to the yacht harbour in a quiet neighbourhood and the room was very clean and well furnished.

Reviews.Title: “Good price value!”
Reviews.Author: resixx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the (family-run) dolphin motel for one night before taking off back home. The hotel staff, especially senior and junior owner, was extremely nice and tried to help wherever possible. The rooms were indeed clean, everything decorated in white and maintained very well. The only negative thing to notice were the quite "thin" walls - we had trouble falling asleep that Friday night, as outside on the streets the party crowd was very noisy and we could hear every single thing in our ground floor room. The hotel is not centrally located, however rather close to the airport and sport fishing docks and marinas. The car ride downtown San Diego takes approx. 10minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Visit”
Reviews.Author: Miniwinnie
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for 1 night due to time pressures but thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Have to say that the team who run the Motel are the friendliest and most helpful that I have had the pleasure to meet. Will definitely return based on the good experience we recieved.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean, small, convenient, friendly”
Reviews.Author: sdpryde
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent (safe, great walking, close to airport, easy to find). The facility is old and the rooms are very small; but they are clean & very functional. Noise could be an issue if you are sensitive to noise. Staff is friendly.... very friendly.... very accommodating. Price is cheap compared to most everything else in San Diego. Read the other reviews. I found them to be accurate. Those that liked/loved the Dolphin did so for just reasons. Those that did not like the Dolphin seemed to have "magical thinking" (ie expecting something that was not there.) I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like the best friend :-)))”
Reviews.Author: lukikarolcia
Reviews.Content: So, me ( living by SF) and my parents from Europe ( first time in the us... ) we went to Dolphin motel for 2 nights. Basic, super clean, small rooms motel. Great breakfast, u feel very confident in this small object. Amazing place by the bay. Very nice view, quiet, cannot get more. It is fabolous place to stay - specially for that price. Close to the old town and downtown. Extra thing customer should say about - accros the street u have a bar in some hotel which is open till 1.30 and is fun kind of creazy place where u can meet some interesting people and have few drinks before u will go to sleep in quiet and comfy motel, it is important specially for me. I am 28 and was looking for a bit of fun before I will go to bed around midnight. And number 1 - the most important: SERVICE. The owner should be famous at least for being helpfull and friendly - his name is Holly. I talk to him for a while. He help us with everything : directions, everywhere, room service, even gave me a ride me to the starbucks when I asked for coffee!!!!!! Amazing guy - I think was a marines before. Anyway in LA I figured out that I left my cellcharger in the room, so he called me about it and send very fast to my SF house - just great. I mean beeing in about 10 motels on my California trip and definetely this place have some extra care for u guys just in case. Fully recomended - Holly u r the man ! keep going like that - ur place is famous for the right reasons

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: BavarianinCal
Reviews.Content: A WONDERFUL CLEAN PLACE FOR VERY LITTLE MONEY AND A VERY FRIENDLY STAFF The Dolphin Motel is very conveniently located, you can get everywhere quickly by car, and the area is nice and quiet, especially at night. The motel is very well-kept and looks very nice. The rooms are kept in white, which looks fresh and clean and gives you a holiday feeling. And it not only looked clean, but WAS impeccably clean. The atmosphere is wonderful, friendly and familiar. Staff was helpful in every way, especially the owner, who took the time to make us hand-drawn maps to the most popular attractions of San Diego. When we left, they even helped us carry our luggage to the car. In the mornings, they have muffins, coffee and orange juice for free, which is totally okay considering the price we paid for the room. Right around the corner is a really good diner/café where we had the most wonderful French toast. At night, you can sit outside on the porch of the motel, which looks out to the marina, and enjoy the summer breeze. In spite of the unbeatably low prices, we felt like we stayed in a truly unique little place where people still care about the well-being of their guests. We highly recommend a stay in this wonderful place!

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem”
Reviews.Author: Dorray43
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this family run gem of a motel.Located at Pt Loma. The owners and staff are very helpful (The owner was kind enough to drop us at one of the tocal tourist site) Small, quiet rooms (with fridge) spotlessly clean thankfully (as we had a bad experience in Las Vegas with bedbugs). Directions,Hand Maps and bus timetables all given if asked for. Muffins, Fruit juice Tea and Coffee provided for breakfast free of charge. Surrounded by Dining places, If like us you do not have a car to rely on the Motel is just across the road from a bus stop and you can get a $5 day pass or pay $2 per ride. This family works hard to earn its fine reputation, Keep up the good work. Observation (not complaint) No Tea/Coffee making machines or phones in room, no brochures or tours booked as a general rule,

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and hospitable Dolphin Motel”
Reviews.Author: themilster
Reviews.Content: The room was small but very clean.The staff was friendly and helpful. We sat in the patio area in our pj's, and enjoy the continental breakfast while we watched the fishing boats pass by. What an enjoyable experience!! The owners of the property do a very good job making guests feel comfortable. I would recommend the Dolphin Motel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: MarieK2.
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading other people's reviews here and just want to back up every positive thing that has been said... fantastically clean, lovely white sheets and bed covers, spotless carpet, great and helpful owners. They charged my phone for me, leant me a laptop and sent us out with directions and restaurant recommendations. I would like to add that I also saw the rooms at the Ramada directly opposite and know that the Dolphin is THE place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe, comfortable, reasonably priced.”
Reviews.Author: mtzirkle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Dolphin for three nights in July 2008. The room was clean, neat, safe, and very comfortable. As some of the other reviewers mentioned, the rooms are a little small, but we were on the go constantly, so it worked out fine for us. The owners and staff are always around seeing to your every need. All of our basic needs were met including a very comfortable bed. We wouldn't think of staying anywhere else when visiting San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Two Thumbs Up for the Dolphin!!”
Reviews.Author: Just_hugh
Reviews.Content: I can see why there are so many positive reviews for the Dolphin Motel. My daughter and I stayed there from August 25-27, 2008. Although the room was quite small in comparison to other hotels, it was very clean and provided quality in the linens and towels. There is a mini fridge which comes in handy. The staff are exceptional. Checking in was a breeze; very friendly person at the front desk. As we were taking our bags to the room the owner, Alan, greeted us and provided us with a tip to go see the Cabrillo National Monument which is just a short drive from the motel. Great views of San Diego and tidepools you can walk in. This motel is in a great location. We were 5 minutes away from Old Town and about 15 minutes away from the cruise ship terminal, the Midway, and the ferry to Coronado island. Whenever I return to beautiful San Diego I will definitely stay at the Dolphin.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Dolphin Motel”
Reviews.Author: tnj420
Reviews.Content: If you want cleanliness, a comfortable mattress and friendly staff to help you feel right at home, stay here. My husband and I went sportfishing for a day and The Dolphin was right across the way, so we decided to try it. We were very pleasantly surprised by the friendly staff, cleanliness of the room and bathroom, they are all white, and the rate! Wow! For the price, we thought we were making a mistake, but we could not have been more wrong. The rooms are quaint, no phones, but WIFI is available and coffee and danishes when you are ready to wake. Thanks to the staff at The Dolphin! You are truely a diamond of a find!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: gymgirl1440
Reviews.Content: The Dolphin Motel was great. We Stayed here two nights while in San Diego and couldn't have asked for a better place. Granted it's not huge or luxurious, but if you don't mind a smaller room it's wonderful. The staff is beyond incredible. They were so nice and gave us directions from hand written maps. They also gave us suggestions for where to eat and what we should do while on our vacation. The owners were very proper and nice also. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Dolphin”
Reviews.Author: RaeMar
Reviews.Content: This is the best place you can stay in San Diego for your money. The room isn't big but it has everything you need and why would you want to stay in your room all the time when you have San Diego to see? The management went above and beyond what could be expected of them and were delighted to be of assistance. Even with the (usually) excellent service we (as Brits) have come to expect in the States, they really looked after us when we needed it and left us to our own devices when we wanted to be. We would recommend buying a day pass for the bus to enable you to get around if you don't have a car. The stop is one block away and the service is very efficient. This motel is best for couples and older travellers. We would definitely return to the Dolphin.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: NotComplete
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Dolphin Motel for two nights. We got in late on the first night and the man at the counter was a very helpful person who even suggested a restaurant and gave a coupon. The next morning my daughter was dieing for some milk. The owner ran to the store to pick some up for her. I don't know of anywhere that takes care of customers like that!! The hotel was very nice, quiet, clean, and affordable, with a great view of the bay. I was concerned about being in a city with just the two of us and being so far away from home but the staff took excellent care of us and helped us know places to go and things to see and do in San Diego. I can't say enough good things about this motel!! Hello to those and much thanks for taking care of the two Murfreesboro, TN girls :)

Reviews.Title: “Give this one a Miss”
Reviews.Author: CountrygirlAustralia
Reviews.Content: We went by Trip Advisor’s rating for this hotel and I can’t understand how it rated so highly. I wonder if we stayed somewhere different!! The bed was the most uncomfortable one I have ever slept in – hard as a brick. The room was small and pokey – smaller than one we had in New York where you expect a small room. There was a veranda and at 6 am people were standing outside our window chatting and drinking their coffee. Breakfast was half a muffin and coffee from an urn set up outside in the courtyard. We had planned to stay 2 nights here but only stayed 1. It was close to the water but miles from the main drag where friends of ours were. It was clean... completely white, no clock and a pokey shower/toilet area. It was cheap I have to say, but the most disappointing hotel in our US vacation of 5 weeks. We stayed at a total of 11 Hotels - most of them from Trip Advisor - thank you :)

Reviews.Title: “2 Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: bjrny
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at the Dolphin in late May. Our room was spotless and the bed very comfortable. We had brought earplugs but never needed them. The owner was very helpful guiding us to our destinations with hand drawn maps. We definitely would book the Dolphin again.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful place, very friendly and helpful management”
Reviews.Author: internaturale
Reviews.Content: Loved the place. Basic but perfectly adequate, comfortable clean rooms. Great location. Great sea breezes. Best value for your buck in San Diego. It's close to everywhere you want to be. This obviously can't be guaranteed for everyone, but at least in my case, management went out of their way to be helpful with travel directions, and planning and in an urgent situation even provided transportation themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Superb/Friendly Service, Excellent Location/Price”
Reviews.Author: backroadrider
Reviews.Content: We stayed following a cruise for one night in an upstairs unit (with our friends next door). The taxi fare from cruise terminal is under $20 (about 4 1/2 miles) and to the airport around $10 (little over a mile). The location is superb especially considering the budget price. The property is only one block from bus line 28 that runs every 20 or so minutes (even on Sunday) directly to/from the transit center at Old Town with transfer there to the trolley to take you throughout the city. The room was small but clean -- and the beds/bedding seemed new. No phones in the room (who needs them anymore anyway) and we didn't need to use the window air conditioner. Plenty of restaurants of all levels nearby. We had an superb dinner at a nearby (and obviously locally popular) fish restaurant: Red Sails. Highlight was the superbly friendly and helpful desk attendant -- who allowed us to store our luggage until our room was ready, printed our early check-in boarding passes, loaned a notebook computer to our traveling companions (free internet) and free coffee in the outside "courtyard." They even have an excellent scale for making sure your bags are not overweight for the flights. While the age of the property and size of the rooms put this motel in the "budget" category -- the service was first class. If you're looking for luxury -- go someplace else. But if you're looking for value, this is your place. We'll choose it first for our future visits .

Reviews.Title: “Love it here!!!”
Reviews.Author: deerae
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay and it was even better than the first! I am so grateful to Tripadvisor for finding this delightful place. If you have forgotten what good customer service feels like, stay here. These people are wonderful and have a special place in my heart. So much so that I wouldn't take the Hotel del Coronado over the Dolphin Motel. It is so quiet, safe and I sleep like a baby. In the morning we wake up to tasty pastries, juice, and coffee. The owners even brought my daughter little snacks to the door, and sent each member of my family on the road with a cold bottle of water. My husband took notice as we sat on our balcony one evening that no detail goes left unnoticed here...you won't find one lighbulb out or one peice of trash on the ground...it is immaculate. The rooms have everything you need for a comfortable stay and everything you don't. The location is terrific...walk across the street and watch the boats come in, or take a five minute drive to the bay to get some sun. We stay there to take in Sea World which is right down the road. I already can't wait for my next stay! Thank you Dolphin Motel for taking such good care of my family!!! See you next April!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Taedra76
Reviews.Content: We got lost looking for the downtown exit and stumbled onto this gem. What caught our eye was the vacancy sign. The rooms are immaculate and the customer service is second to none. The owners are very friendly and make sure you are well taken care of. The motel is minutes away from downtown. The price was right too!! What we paid for three nights was about the price for one at a nearby chain. They also have free wi-fi which was wonderful. I recommend this motel if you want to have a nice, clean, comfortable place to stay the next time you are in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Retro motel with retro price! :)”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug35
Reviews.Content: DH and I stayed here one night pre-cruise and thought it was worth every penny. The owners are sweet, sweet people and actually apologized for chatting with us so long. We assured him we southern folks are used to chatting with strangers on a daily basis! This is a motel, yes, so please don't expect the Ritz. The windows are not insulated so you will hear some street noise and the rooms are small. However, it's clean, has cool retro-styling with neon, the water pressure is great, and the free juice, coffee, muffins, etc. were all very good. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Best Buy”
Reviews.Author: svanwass
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect hotel for those on a tight budget or if your just staying one night. It is very close to the airport so, if you have a layover or get stuck with a cancelled flight, this is the place to go. The rooms are small but clean. The property is well kept and the location is nice. The marina is right across the street with a few shops and restaurants to chose from. Best of all is the price. You will not find a better deal in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: cherishee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for 2 nights for Valentine's and as a side trip from Las Vegas. This hotel is in a great location and suited our budget conscious needs very well. I loved how this hotel was very close to everything. Ocean Beach, Downtown, The Zoo was all a quick drive away. The rooms are wonderfully clean and the furniture was basic but functional. Its true the rooms are super small and the walls are starting to show a bit of wear and tear but what do you expect for $65 a night? You get a big roomy fridge compared to other hotels. The water pressure in the shower is strong! So strong it almost hurts but I'm sure a lot of people like that. The owner is a very sweet and helpful old man. We were planning on splurging and staying at The Pearl behind the Dolphin Motel, but we were very glad we chose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Us”
Reviews.Author: rastawoman123
Reviews.Content: We found this adorable motel through the TripAdvisor website. It seemed to perfectly fit our needs, and during our stay the great customer service and high standards became all the more evident. All of the good things stated here are true. The Dolphin is clean, convenient, and the owners maintain a high level of customer service. We had booked our stay well in advance and management acommodated the quirks of our reservation. We stayed 2 days, checked out for a 1 day trip up to Los Angeles, and we had the same room for 2 days when we returned. When our daughter flew in for 1 night to join us unexpectedly, they immediately were able to give her a room right next to ours. This was high season in S.D. The location is near to the airport but out of the flight path, and there is a lovely view of the San Diego Sportfishing area across the way. My husband can't wait to return and catch some more yellowtail. We ate good for a month. Just remember to bring an adequate cooler to keep in your car as "no fish in rooms". End of story. This place wants to keep it CLEAN. No kidding. And that's a good thing. The porch area outside of the rooms provides a nice area to relax and enjoy the beautiful weather. We were able to hop over to Coronado, our favorite beach in S.D., within a short drive. Other S.D. attractions are nearby. Don't overlook this relatively inexpensive alternative to a stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room & staff at a great price”
Reviews.Author: seeksthesun
Reviews.Content: As a single traveler with a limited budget, this place was perfect for me. I stayed for 2 nights and would have stayed longer if I hadn't been heading to other parts of the county. The owner and staff were very approachable and helpful. My room was squeaky clean and, most importantly, had absolutely no odor. The bathroom was in great condition with a nice shower. The Dolphin is in an interesting neighborhood -- I prefer staying "off the beaten path" away from touristy areas. There's a new shopping center (with a Trader Joe's) nearby and I discovered Shelter Island, which is a pleasant place for a morning walk. All in all, the Dolphin is a comfortable, quiet and affordable place that made me love San Diego even more!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome & Would Love to Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: wumblymumbly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for ten days and had a great time. The prices were great, only $60-70 per night! Delicious muffins, coffee, and orange juice available in the morning too complimentary. The manager will make you hot tea also. The rooms are small but we got along by keeping things tidy on a daily basis. We talked to the owner and the management and they were very kind and caring on a daily basis, which was really a selling point for us. I liked the accessibility that we were allowed, being able to talk directly to the manager and owner was much better than having to go through a receptionist. Even though it's a little motel they have a security system and we felt that we were very safe. Sheets are changed every other day, with new towels and soap provided daily. The only amenities provided in the rooms are soap, plastic cups, and ice bucket, so bring all toiletries including shampoo and conditioner. The only issue we had was there was a little mold and a spider living in the bathroom, but he didn't bother us. Also, there is no telephone in the room, which I thought was weird, but free wifi is provided for your laptop, which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: royalfood
Reviews.Content: I had reason to stay at the Dolphin for several days between homes. It is by far the cleanest room I have stayed in for several years. The management is there hands-on (some for 24hrs.) daily. The customer's comfort is their TOP priority. It is very convenient to the Bay, the airport, downtown and is within walking distance to excellent restaurants. If there was a rating higher than five stars, the Dolphin Motel would get it from me.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: TomPatrick
Reviews.Content: Needed 3 rooms as close to the Ramada as possible. After reading their reviews I picked the Dolphin. The rooms are small, basic but very clean. The staff is excellent. Not the usual vacant stare after a basic question followed by a "sorry" for being no help. The owner, Holly, has these guys trained. Security at the property is excellent. Great coffee, donuts and pastry in the morning. Need a computer, use their laptop. Forgot your corkscrew, they have a bunch. The owner let me park onsite for a week while gone. I then stayed one night again and felt the same way about the property. The group loved the place for its logistics for our trip. Not the Ritz but for the price a great find.

Reviews.Title: “"Loved the Dolphin"”
Reviews.Author: JASCasadeOro
Reviews.Content: We are considered ourself a local tourist, just needed a place to get away from the kids for a day - while grandparent taking care of them. We heard from friends, motel is in a great location - just accross the street from Fisherman Landing and beatiful harbour. Also located near by "Point Loma Seafood", one of the best seafood restaurant in San Diego and other several restaurant within walking distance. Very clean, convenient, friendly, reasonable, safe and services are great. They also provide their guest with "Free Internet and Wi-Fi" access, maybe next time around will bring my laptop. A wonderful staff, from front desk, housekeeping and maintenance - thank you. Will be coming back soon, when my wife and i get the chances.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny but spotless room - wonderfully helpful owner”
Reviews.Author: lsabug
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had a wonderful stay at the Dolphin Motel, it was across the street from one of the main boat docks and located close to most of the major attractions (Sea World, Cabrillo Natl Monument, Midway, etc.). Our initial impression of the motel when we arrived was that it was quite small, we were somewhat taken aback by the size of the rooms but they were clean and ours had a refrigerator. I was also very impressed with the sense of security I had from the locations of the surveillance cameras which covered the entire premises. The first morning there we were approached by the owner (we thought he was another tourist) who was so very helpful. He offered us tips on where to stay and even got us maps to the sites he recommended. Plus he pointed us to a small restaurant, Point Break, about 2 blocks away that served generous and tasty portions (three eggs, hashbrowns and toast for about $5 bucks). We were also there when the wildfires hit and while I don't necessarily agree with raising prices during such a sad and stressful time, I don't think that $20 is exploitive when you consider their typical rate is $70 on any other day. I would definitely stay there again, morning coffee was delicious, so not typical motel coffee.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL Hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: SDLundh
Reviews.Content: The motel is in a GREAT location! Just across the street is the beautiful harbour and is located near several inexpensive restaurants. Right after I arrived the motel owner came to my room to welcome me. Following each night I was there, I was given a ride to the MCRD by the owner. They are the motel with a HEART! The rooms are small, but VERY clean and well kept. I would definitely stay with them again if I am ever in town. A special thank you to the whole staff, you were wonderful!!!!

Reviews.Title: “So nice!”
Reviews.Author: TicinoMoLo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this motel 3 nights in August 2007. The room was small but very clean and had on it all we needed (air conditioning, tv, fridge). The owner and the staff were always very helpful, either with road directions, either with advices about what to see and what to do. We had the chance to use the computer from the reception in our room, which was good as we didn't have one with us. The location is great; close to downtown but in a relaxing area. Breakfast is basic but just perfect for us; juice and muffins. We will come back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great little independent”
Reviews.Author: Ceciliepus
Reviews.Content: Clean, reasonable, friendly, safe, convenient with excellent personable advice and service. Lovely all white all cotton squeeky clean linen and room. We would stay anytime. R&K, London

Reviews.Title: “Quirky but Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: VivaRobVegas
Reviews.Content: Superbly located opposite the harbour and within easy access to Downtown and other beach areas, the Dolphin Motel has a simple philosophy of "give us a chance and compare". This attracted me to it instantly - it was a no BS approach, and they didn't let themselves down. Having never been to San Diego before, I was unsure of the location, but once we were settled, we found it very easy to get anywhere we needed to go; and the added assistance of the front desk staff and particularly the owner who provided basic but effective hand drawn maps and easy to follow directions. However, I would suggest that if you wish to explore wider San Diego, then a car is a necessity. The rooms are quite small, but well appointed for the price, and the beds are extremely comfortable with crisp white linen. The bathrooms are tight, but the shower has the best water pressure of any hotel I have ever stayed at. The clientele of the hotel appear to be mainly people using the harbour for fishing or diving trips, and given they are up quite early in the morning, do not expect a sleep in, as the central courtyard area can get quite noisy. The complimentary continental breakfast provided consists of muffins & coffee, and is a welcome start to the day, however, those after a substantial breakfast will need to jump in the car and find a cafe or diner. Car parking is free as well, and there are plenty of spaces available. They are very clear about no-smoking in the rooms ($100 fine), yet they are happy for guests to smoke in the courtyard area, except for cigars, which we were told off for smoking. Go figure. Overall, this small but well maintained motel is a great place to stay if you are not too fussed about not having the little luxuries - ie, they only provide soap and no shampoo or conditioner, although they do offer these items for a nominal fee at the front desk. I would stay here again if I came to San Diego, but there are a couple of budget chain motels next door as options if the Dolphin is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Pros & Cons”
Reviews.Author: Rockabilly-Raz
Reviews.Content: First the positive. Fantastic location. On the harbour front. 15 mins drive to anywhere. Fantastic supply of accurate hand drawn maps available from reception. They made sure we didn't get lost once. Friendliest service you will get. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff. The maid even offered to dry our beach towels for us. Price. Very cheap for the location. Cleanliness. Absolutely spotless. Now the negative. Very very small rooms. Paper thin walls.Just hope you don't have noisy neighbours. The TV;s have a volum limit on them to try and ensure you don't annoy your neighbours. Noisy AC. Don't keep it on all night or you won't sleep. Rooms have all had a recent lick of paint, but need a bit of a refurb as some of the fittings (shower etc) look a bit tired. For the price, it's fantastic. Don't be fooled into thinking it's a 5 star hotel. Its a budget motel

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: milys
Reviews.Content: The motel i located in a excellent spot in Point Loma. It's a very basic motel with small rooms and old furniture. The owners where very nice and helpfull. But, the motel has one big problem: its very noisy. Both nights we waked up in the middle of the night by the television in the rooms above. One night we could't sleep because the couple above us hade very loud sex (and then I mean, really loud). So, I would stay here again, but if you don't mind a very basic room and sleeps lika a baby it's ok.

Reviews.Title: “basic, nice, small”
Reviews.Author: peregrino76
Reviews.Content: Booking was complicated with the guys. I called them from my european cellphone which made the booking procedure expensive, they where very slow and it took them about 20 minutes... The motel is very well located next to the harbour and it is fun going down there in the morning watch the fishing crews go on the boats and in the evening see them coming back. The room we were in was tiny, had AC, fridge and TV. The bathroom was tiny too. Everything was clean and nice. The place doesn't have a pool. For what you get I think it is not so perfect as others say. I think you might get better places for the same money. We payed 82 $ for the first night and 116 $ for the second. If you stay there go to the harbour just across the street. You can see a bar with a shop for fishers on your right hand. Go there!!! Having a Caesar Salad with grilled shrimps and a Corona watching the sunset and the fishermen on the porch direct at the sea is amazing, the food is perfect! Try breakfast too, awesome pancakes!!!! Unfortunately I don't remember the name. The place next door has huge icecream cones! Try them too!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: LuvToFlySW
Reviews.Content: This was a great place for us! Married for just under 8 months and still in college = little money to spend! We loved it! Our total for two nights, a thursday and a friday, came out to be about $175 Plus $33 for the Fisherman's Special!! We had checked out and gone deep sea fishing with H & M Landing. We don't reccomend going on the The Premier, the crew was kinda rude and not very helpful. They also fling smelly fish water and who knows what else on everyone as they throw the bait into the water. Which explains the Fisherman's Special at the Dolphin Motel. After returning from the fishing trip we needed a place to clean up, for $33 bucks, you get a room for another two hours! Well worth it after getting fish guts thrown all over us! The staff was helpful, and friendly. The rooms are just like everyone else says. White, clean and small but cozy! This is a great place to stay if you want to go cheaper than the other hotels and just need a place to sleep! Why pay more for a good nights rest?? We highly recommend the Dolphin Motel for anyone who wants just that!

Reviews.Title: “Great position, clean, but small and basic.”
Reviews.Author: ifand
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms and clean and white. However they are small. Very small, compared with most that we encountered in the US. They have what is required for a short stay however. Would suggest that the motel should be considered as a place to sleep only - not for a long stay. The area appears very safe with sufficient restaurants within easy walking distance. The owners & management are very helpful and knowledgeable. Perfect for sport fishing as it's right at the port. Prices vary hugely. It's a bargain at the prices shown on the website but you don't want to pay a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “A touch of nostalgia at a great price”
Reviews.Author: sdflyer
Reviews.Content: Having spent many vacations in San Diego, my husband and I chose the Dolphin Motel for annual trip to the San Diego Pride Weekend. Its located in the Point Loma area, just a few miles west of the airport. Its a quiet area of the city and the marina and sportfishing harbor are across the street. Point Loma Seafoods, long known for its fresh seafood is also just a block away. The Dolphin was probably built back in the 60's and still retains the nostalgic flavor. We were skeptical at first glance since most old motels have become run down and best forgotten. Not the Dolphin; Its been maintained to high standards of cleanliness. Our room was immaculately clean, easily proven by the overwhelming use of white color. The motel grounds were spotless. We never saw a cigarette butt or scrap of paper anywhere. After check-in, the owner met us at our room and opened the door. Hospitable and friendly, he took the time to familiarize us with the few details about the room, including the free DSL and WiFi access. He offered the use of a laptop computer if needed, but we had our own. The room is small and amenities are limited to the internet access and a small refrigerator. There is no pool on the property but the free parking is well lit at night. The Dolphin's room rates are inexpensive and all things considered, its an excellent choice for a convenient and spotlessly clean place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “wish there were more like this around! What a great lil' find!!!”
Reviews.Content: What a great clean friendly place! When I travel I want clean convient and safe . I dont travel for the hotel but rather to experience the area. . I travel freq and must say by European standard this place is large, by American its small by any standard it sure was clean and "white".. We had room 36 which was right over the office and quiet . In the morning sipping our free coffee and muffins we sat on our balcony watching the boats across the street coming in with their catch. Huge fish 200+ lbs! The owner who is a really knowledgable friendly man gave us tips on some of the best seafood at the Point Loma which is right across the street and a yummy Italian neighborhood place- something Venice. I giggle when I think I approached him sitting at the outside table and asked him if he was familar with the area and he said sure could he help...he provided all sorts of great info including the fact taht he owns the place! He even has maps of some of the places to go to.Its a convient place for the areas attractions. When we travel on short getaways this is the jewels we like to find. These prices made the Dolphin a great value.

Reviews.Title: “What a great motel!”
Reviews.Author: LVTink
Reviews.Content: I chose the Dolphin Motel based on the Trip Advisor reviews and was very pleased with our visit. We stayed five nights in the middle of May, including a Sat. & Sun. and couldn't have been happier with the accomodations. I knew in advance that it was a "budget" motel so I checked with Holly by phone and brought my own hair dryer & alarm clock - no phone but we both had our cells. The rooms are small but when you're just sleeping there, why care? Bring your own bath sheets, though - the towels are small and scratchy! Really comfy beds, free WiFi, nice courtyard and SAFE neighborhood. I walked every morning and just loved how close it was to the Bay and residential neighborhoods. The refrigerator is twice the size of the one at the Grand Californian in Disneyland ($500 a night) and the water pressure and temperature were a joy! We walked to great restaurants each day, loved being just across the street from the Sport Fishing Harbor and never drove more than 15 minutes to all our adventures - PETCO, Old Town, Seaport Village. The owners know everything about San Diego and are really concerned about your comfort. It was quiet and spotless. The place is a little older but the neighborhood and location are more than I expected and the service from the owners is unparelleled. We both work in hotels in Las Vegas and understand superior customer service - Holly & Alan get it. With what we saved on our room by NOT staying in a chain at $200 + each night, we were able to do it all in San Diego. I have recommended this motel to three of my friends and my daughter & son-in-law will be staying there in the fall. Do yourself a favor and check it out. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Excessive Price / Dishonest reservation staff”
Reviews.Author: pinkhorse
Reviews.Content: After seeing the good reviews about how clean and inexpensive this place is, I called them up to see what their room rates were two months in advance of my target stay. Their website says during peak season, the room rate is: $65 - $95. Yet, when I spoke to the reservation desk, the male who answered quoted me $150, which is a 50% mark-up on their posted web price!! I understand that they had an asterisk on their website stating *excluding holidays & special events. When I informed him that I wanted to search around before booking, he pressured me by telling me that the weekend I wanted was during the San Diego Street Scene Weekend. Well, I looked it up, and Street Scene 2007 is Sept. 22-23 (which is a MONTH LATER). Either it was a mistake or it was just plain dishonest. The excessive price does not merit the accommodations described. I won't be staying at this place because they seem to be money hungry. Looks like they are trying to cash in on their high rankings on Tripadvisor. I hope you have better luck.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: MikeS1111
Reviews.Content: We found the Trip Advisor reviews of the Dolphin Motel to be accurate. The good news is the Dolphin is exactly what people say it is: inexpensive, no frills, small, clean, centrally located and a great value. We slept well (in the end unit on the second floor above the office). I did not see any reviews of the bathroom shower, but I'm going to give a special 5 star award to our shower which was an unexpected surprise. My wife and I are so used to "water-saver" fixtures that we've given up on getting a decent shower in any hotel.
