My wife was thrilled to have "water pressure" (and I do mean water pressure!) in the shower. Bravo, Dolphin! First time visitors should prepare themselves for some oddities that make the Dolphin what it is. As one reviewer mentioned, the reservation process is peculiar. You have to send a check to reserve the first night - then you can pay for the following night(s) with a credit card. I don't know why -- that's just the way it is. When we arrived at the Dolphin to check it out, our initial reaction was that it was an old TraveLodge motel that had been converted into a Mom and Pop. The huge neon sign and drive-up office with racks of keys, weight scale and video surveillance is off-putting -- like you've entered some sort of alternate motel universe. My wife's initial apprehension was not lessened by a visit to the one of the motel rooms - it was spartan small, with home-made nightstands, and brilliant high gloss white paint that could be wiped clean with 409 or windex. I assured her repeatedly that it was okay - that ALL those good folks at TripAdvisor wouldn't lead us astray (would they?) Reluctantly, she agreed to let me reserve the room. How bad could it be, I figured? When we arrived this past Memorial Day weekend, the weather was drab and overcast. We were planning on taking a dip in the pool and sunning ourselves, but the weather was too cold. Nevertheless, we decided to check the water temperature by taking a walk down to the pool. Unfortunately, we couldn't find the entry gate. We soon learned from the desk clerk that the pool that sits out in front of the motel doesn't belong to the Dolphin, but to the motel next door. My wife told me she would not have been happy if the weather had been sunny and hot and she couldn't go swimming. Be forewarned! That pretty pool with the lawn out front belongs to the other guys! That complaint aside, we slept incredibly well on a firm queen mattress. Our room was very quiet and spotless. On a cleanliness note, the white bed comforter was pristine clean - to underscore the Dolphin's obsession with white, white, white. The air-conditioning unit worked well and shielded some outside noise. Also, we enjoyed sitting on the balcony outside our room earlier that evening with a cocktail, watching the sailboats across the street at the marina. On a related note, the video surveillance cameras that surround the property and the highly visible desk staff probably discourage potential visitors who think that the Dolphin would be a great place to drink and party all night. Our neighbors were quiet and courteous, as was the staff and owner whose primary concern appears to be maintaining quality at reasonable prices. The Dolphin is not the Ritz, but if you're looking for a great deal it can't be beat. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “a bit pricey for an average budget motel.”
Reviews.Author: BudgetBeachBum
Reviews.Content: I am a budget traveller who has stayed in many cheap motels and hostels over the years. The Dolphin Motel in particular is a bit pricey, for what they have to offer, in comparison to what I have stayed in previously. They are in a relatively good location, so maybe that is why the prices are a little higher. I paid $95 for a tiny room with no windows the first night and $75 in a room with a window the next night. Somewhat inconvenient and odd is that you have to mail them a cheque for the first nights stay. All the rooms are very small but very clean. The beds are comfortable. The bathrooms have showers but no bath tub. The walls are thin, so if you're a light sleeper you might want to wear ear plugs. Good sized parking lot. Walking around at night it felt like a safe neighborhood. The "breakfast" they offered was so-so. Overall the staff was very accomodating and my stay was good.

Reviews.Title: “You kinda get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: Jeema
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this motel for I think 5 nights. First of all, it is definitely not the best motel in San Diego. I have no idea how it got such a high rating here on trip advisor...price I suppose. Oh well - with that said, on to the review: Firstly, the positive. It *is* cheap, and it is very close to the airport (about 5 minutes away) and most of the interesting downtown attractions. The rooms are pretty clean. The management is very friendly and accomodating. I had a couple problems with noise and they were very accomodating in switching me rooms and also telling some noisy people to quiet down after hours - and since there's 24 hour desk service, there's always someone to complain to about noise issues. Which brings us to the negative: the noise. If you're a noise sensitive person, you may have some problems. The walls are paper thin, as are the ceilings. During the week, things were not so bad, but not so much on the weekends or when the place is full. If you *are* noise-sensitive and you insist on staying here, I would at the very least recommend that you request a 2nd floor room, preferably at one of the ends of the motel. The other negative is that the rooms are indeed very small as some people have already mentioned. This may not be a big deal if you're not going to be in your room much anyway, but it really is probably the smallest motel/hotel room I've ever been in. In conclusion, a decent motel if you are not sensitive to noises. Otherwise I would recommend you spend the extra money and look elsewhere...

Reviews.Title: “Great as usual”
Reviews.Author: queban
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Dolphin Motel is a relief....no long waits for elevators to take you to an expensive hotel room with all these "amenities" that you probably won't use; no rude desk clerks, no "service charges"; ok-I'll stop. What do you get at the Dolphin? A feeling of being welcome Comfortable and CLEAN room Friendly Staff Continential breakfast View of the marina Free internet access Great Location Money in your pocket to spend on activities around San Diego I'll be back...again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Travel_ALL_50
Reviews.Content: San Diego, CA Dolphin Motel April 2007 Service: The registration process was particularly quirky at the Dolphin. They would not take our credit card number over the phone even though they take credit cards at the registration desk. This seemed very odd, as it is 2007. (We were prepared for it based on some previous reviews, however.) We were told we could guarantee the room by check or take our chances that the room would be available if we arrived after 6:00 PM. I decided to wait and talk it over with the significant other. She and I agreed – on THREE things: that there was no reason to send a check; that we would probably get there before 6:00 PM and that there would be no harm if the room was resold. We would simply find a room elsewhere. When I called back we went through this all again. I explained we would take our chances with the room not being available if we arrived after 6:00 pm. Then they asked for a cell phone number. I wasn’t expecting that and as I am a little protective of the cell number I stated I didn’t want to provide it. This started another round of unnecessary discussion. They seemed unsure if they could reserve the room without the cell phone number. The Dolphin representative then handed the phone over to another rep. We went through the scenario yet again and quickly came to the conclusion that it would be fine for me to reserve a room and take a chance that it would be available if we arrived after 6:00 pm. This seemed a very long route to get to the point where we could actually make a reservation. If the rankings weren’t so stellar, I would have quickly looked elsewhere. I’ll admit I was very curious. Upon arrival, before 6:00 PM, everything was in order. Rooms/Cleanliness: Our second story room had a slight view of the marina across the street. The rooms are small and very basic. Ours had one bed, a TV and a refrigerator. Other furniture was of simple board construction. Everything was painted white. The bathroom contained a small shower – no tub. All of the above was VERY clean. Location: We found the Dolphin to be very convenient to Sea World and Cabrillo National Monument/Point Loma. It is located across from a large sport fishing marina. This is an eclectic neighborhood. While it wasn’t for us, I can see how parking could be a problem in this area. Value: We paid $71 including tax in April 2007. I have to dock it a point for its quirkiness. However, given the location, cleanliness and the fact that this is San Diego I feel it is an above average value.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean; hospitable staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelerAl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two nights in the Dolphin Motel based on its uniformly positive ratings on the TripAdvisor website. The reviews are accurate. It's relatively quiet, very clean, and a very good value. And the staff is hospitable. Rooms aren't large, but on the second floor there are chairs outside on the balcony if you need to expand. We would recommend the first floor if mobility or carrying bags up stairs is a problem for you. We'll stay there again next time we are in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sbtpbl
Reviews.Content: 20 years later and I'm still staying at the best hotel in San Diego. Small and quiet, clean and comfortable. A staff that you can have a conversation with and not feel like "just a customer." With the money saved here you can afford to take the kids to SeaWorld!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff at Dolphin Motel”
Reviews.Author: val31cma
Reviews.Content: This is a modest motel in a GREAT area. Very affordable and the staff made the stay wonderful. The rooms very clean and the beds are more comfortable than most hotel beds. There is no phone or alarm clock in the room I stayed in, but if you have a cell phone you don't really need one. The room I stayed in did have a refrigerator which was nice and the muffins for breakfast were very good. I would definately stay here again because of the value. When you save this much on a place to sleep, you can definately spend more on gifts, amusment parks, and dinners.

Reviews.Title: “Dumpy Dolphin”
Reviews.Author: sallyhess
Reviews.Content: I called the hotel after reading reviews and was told to send a check for the first nights lodging as I was staying a week. I found this odd in this day and age and was told they got burned by a credit card holder on a room. No problem and I paid the remainder by cash, close to 500 for the week when I checked in. Holly, the owner is delightful and very helpful and hard working. His son, maning the desk not nearly as plesant or welcoming. It is close to the bus to the city and right across the street from the fishermans wharf and you could see the fireworks at night from seaworld. The rooms themselves are bare bones with a mini fridge, shower only, no tub, and no dresser but a small closet area. They serve coffee, donuts and juice in the morning, a nice touch in the courtyard with a few tables and chairs. The price was good compared to surrounding hotels which were twice as much but a bit nicer. I wouldn't stay there again and did book after viewing their web site.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal, Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: zuccabella
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small and basic. The bed wasn't super comfortable but was fine for a few days. The bedding was clean and white (even the quilt). We had cable tv, a wall unit AC that worked well, mini fridge and standup shower. The employees are all extremely accomodating. They mapped directions to anywhere we wanted to go and even mailed a package for me. I stayed with my husband for 3 nights and I think it was by far the best deal in San Diego. The location is also excellent. Right on the harbor and a quick drive up to any of the beaches. There is also Point Loma Seafood across the street - one of the best around. I highly recommend this place for non-luxury travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: LBJ123
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research, this was the ONLY place I could find for under $150/night in coastal SD (barring the Super 8's in Fashion Valley and that sort of thing). I read the motel reviews here - including the ones about its former life as a "no tell motel" - and took the plunge. I swore if it was a great place I would post here. So THANK YOU to those who've left reviews previously, and I hope this is helpful to other folks searching for a good place to stay. The Dolphin is literally across the street from the sport fishing marina in Point Loma and close to cute little places to grab a drink or some food. Otherwise, if you're a tourist, there is not much in the way of major sightseeing to be done in the immediate vicinity. Still, it's 5-10 minutes from area freeways; 15 minutes from downtown or 20 to Del Mar. The motel itself is a little worn around the edges, but well-cared for: very clean, absolutely no complaints. Awesome neon on the motel as well. Bare basic ammentities (shower, mini fridge, TV, air conditioning, bed, zero else [you wouldn't've been able to fit it in, anyway]). Room was teeny tiny but comfortable. We had one with a mirror at the head of the bed, a remnant from days of yore I spose, and we had a good chuckle over that one. Mornings there's coffee and donuts in the "courtyard." The men who run the place were a little gruff but very good to us, supplying us with maps and recommendations as asked. We felt very safe and well taken care of. Overall I 100% recommend The Dolphin Motel for budget or adventuresome travelers; this would be a great homebase if you're a sport fishing fan, or want something slightly off the beaten path and the peace/quiet that offers, or just want to stay somewhere thrifty and a tiny bit funky (good funky, not bad funky). I stayed for a "romantic getaway" - and no, not for the mirrors - and we had a great time. If you're looking for something with a chain hotel vibe and amentities, or are traveling with a family (or a bunch of people in one room): look elsewhere, there's lots of other stuff nearby. But I will DEFINITELY be back to The Dolphin!

Reviews.Title: “Dolphin Motel, San Diego Ca”
Reviews.Author: MJJ
Reviews.Content: Very Clean, helpful and nice office staff, walls thin, could hear snoring neighbor. I would stay again when i needed a budget hotel, in fact I've called to stay again two times within a month of my 4th of july stay and they tripled the rates on what would have been my 2nd stay and doubled them on the 3rd attempt. Price Gouging will keep me from using them again. The product is a budget product which is priced fairly in slow times and outrageous at others. MJ

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Motel”
Reviews.Author: Doobs1976
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Dolphin Motel for 3 nights in June, we chose this motel after reading some of the reviews on this site. We were looking for a cheap motel that was clean and safe, the Dolphin did not disappoint. The rooms had everything that was needed, fridge, nice bathroom, comfortable bed and was kept very clean. The staff here were very friendly and gave us directions and recommendations of where to visit which really helped. The harbour opposite is lovely and I would recommend staying here for anyone looking for budget accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely outstanding! Could not ask for a greater place in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the dolphin for 5 days in June 2006 (I am a student on vacation through the west coast) and found the service to be above what you would find almsot anywhere. The owner, whose name I have forgotten, (Chief, as I called him) is one of the nicest people I have had the pleasure to meet.I arrived in San Diego not knowing what to do or where to go, and he took the time to explain the best places to go, and how to get to them. This kind man alone is reason enough to stay. For example: On day 2, my visa card was jammed by my bank in the UK (always let your bank know when you go abroad!!!), leaving me without cash temporarily (my parents sent me some through western union) and the owner offered to loan me some money to get some food. Like I said, a wonderful man! The rooms were lovely. Extremely clean, wonderful beds with great bathrooms attached, soft towels etc. The Dolphin also had free DSL and cable TV with many channels, a fridge, and some of the rooms had lovely views of the harbor. I could not fault the Dolphin in anyway, and as far as value for money goes, I invite people to try to find better. It cost about $50 a night and was worth far more than that. You do not need to stay anywhere else in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Motel Deal in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: MariaSuzette
Reviews.Content: The Dolfin Motel is the cleanest, safest, most economical motel in San Diego. I have stayed there numerous times over the past year and it has always been a pleasurable experience. The rooms are 'no frills' but offer comfy beds, cable TV and a view of the San Diego Bay (right across the street). Doughnuts and coffee are free every morning. A swimming pool is on the grounds. The location is unbeatable in cozy Point Loma (one of the largest Sportfishing marinas in the US)--5 minutes from the San Diego Airport, 10 minutes from downtown, and easy highway access to all San Diego recreation spots. Within walking distance are lovely little restaurants, Humphreys on Shelter Island for concerts, day spa and beauty salons... and many places to take a walk or just sit and enjoy the views. Holly, the owner/manager of the Dolfin Motel, and his staff are very attentive to the guests and will work hard to make your stay comfortable. Rates are from $45 and up depending on the season. (--) Give it a try!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: CajunLover08
Reviews.Content: My stay here was better than would be expected. Very clean rooms. Curteous and helpful front desk help (at all hours). Pretty quiet. No security problems, well lit and open. Well worth what you pay. I'm coming back soon.

HotelInfo.Name: Dolphin Motel
HotelInfo.Address: 2912 Garrison St, San Diego, CA 92106
